t: I tried the Amazon Plants Store and got covered in wet dirt | Mashable
s: Ready to expand my plant collection, I set out to explore my options. In addition to supporting my local greenhouse, I decided to order three plants from the Amazon Plants Store in the name of service journalism. The idea of a living organism arriving at my door in a cardboard box seemed deeply impractical and vaguely (OK, very) dystopian, but I still wanted to try it. I ordered a pothos ($17.57) and two aloe vera plants ($16.99), all from the brand ...
